Collects Crisis aftermath, The Spectre, 1-3, and Tales of the unexpected, 1-3.
Summary (from SkyRiver): The supernatural spirit of vengeance has joined with a new host: Detective Crispus Allen from the Gotham City Police Department.

149.title:  The Spectre. Eclipso : the Music of the Spheres
149.author: Matthew Sturges, writer ; Stephen Jorge Segovia, Chad Hardin, pencillers.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Countdown to Mystery 1-8."

"Once Eclipso was the Wrath of God incarnate. Now he's a shadow of his former self, corrupting superheroes in his pursuit of a lost artifact. With a growing army under his influence, Eclipso can finally recapture the Heart of Darkness and become more powerful than ever before! Only the almighty Spectre stands in the way of Eclipso's destructive destiny. With a grudge spanning several millennia, can the Spirit of Vengeance silence the Prince of Darkness before he ushers in an era of all-consuming villainy?"

150.title:  The Spectre. Final Crisis : Revelations
150.author: Greg Rucka, writer ; Philip Tan, penciller ; Jonathan Glapion, Jeff de los Santos, Walden Wong, inkers ; Ian Hannin, Nei Rufino, colorists ; John J
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Final Crisis: Revelations 1-5, Final Crisis: Secret Files 1."

Summary (from SkyRiver): When Darkseid, the malevolent New God, wages a brainwashing war against mankind, it is up to the Question, Batwoman, and the Spectre, the embodiment of vengeance, to take down the mad god's followers before all hope is lost.

221.title:  The Spectre of Tomorrow. Atomic Robo and the Spectre of Tomorrow
221.author: words, Brian Clevinger ; art, Scott Wegener ; colors, Anthony Clark ; letters, Jeff Powell.
notes: Originally published as Atomic Robo and the Spectre of Tomorrow issues #1-#5.

Summary (from amazon.com via OCLC): "Remember the old days when all you had to worry about were mad scientist-dinosaurs or giant sea mutants with lasers? But not in 2017! Atomic Robo delves into the chaos that is modern America, where everything is horrible all of the time! But that's why Robo is setting up the new Tesladyne Institute in the badlands of New Mexico's Jornada del Muerto desert, with Sir Richard Branson's Spaceport on one side and Elon Musk's Solar Farm on the other. With neighbors like these, who needs to uncover an insidious plot that threatens the lives of everyone in the world?"

259.title:  Spectrum. Garage Band
259.author: Gipi ; translation by Spectrum.
notes: "Originally published in France in 2005 under the title Le Local by Gallimard Jeunesse, Paris"

Summary (from OCLC): Four troubled boys, Guiliano, Stefano, Alberto, and Alex, form a band. They practice in a garage that Guilano's dad loaned them. When their amp blows right before the deadline for their demo tape, the boys become desperate to replace it and land themselves in more trouble than they know how to handle.

273.title:  The Spectrum War. Star Trek, Green Lantern : the Spectrum War
273.author: written by Mike Johnson ; art by Angel Hernandez ; colors by Alejandro Sanchez ; letters by Neil Uyetake.
notes: Originally published as Star Trek/Green Lantern issues #1-6.

Summary (from OCLC): Two iconic franchises collide for this blockbuster crossover event! The crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise meets the Green Lantern Corps for the first time in an all-new adventure that spans the cosmos! Kirk and Spock make a most unusual discovery on a lost world, igniting events that will change the fate of empires.

274.title:  "Spectrums of Deceit!"
274.author: Roger Slifer, writer ; George Perez, penciler ; Pablo Marcos, Ric Villamonte, inkers

275.title:  "Speculation : Financial Games and Derivative Worlding in a Transmedia Era"
275.author: N
275.appears_in: Katherine Hayles, Patrick Jagoda, and Patrick LeMieux. p. 220-236 in Comics & Media : Special issue of Critical Inquiry (Chicago : The University of Chicago Press, 2014).

276.title:  Speculation. "The All-Food Channel"
276.author: Nicole Hollander.
notes: Summary: Sylvia speculates about future cable channels; this one will have cooking shows, pie throwing movies, and segments about sausage and eggs.

277.title:  Speculation. "All I Know Is She's Totally Hot!"
277.author: Cantu & Castellanos.
notes: Summary: Why speculate if she's Mexican, Cuban or Puerto Rican?

278.title:  Speculation. "The Ape"
278.author: by Silverio Pisu ; illustrated by Milo Manara
278.appears_in: p. 33-40 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 8 (Nov. 1982).
notes: "Last issue, the young ape mastered the magical trick of transforming himself into practically anything. He then flew off to aid his people in the grotto of the hanging water and wound up fighting the demon of speculation."

279.title:  Speculation. The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
279.author: [No author]

280.title:  Speculation. "I Say We Wait Him Out"
280.author: Cullum.
notes: Summary: The boys are cornered by a Rottweiler, and speculate on the average life span of the breed.

281.title:  Speculation. "I Wasn't Expecting There'd Be Rats in Heaven"
281.author: by Paul Gilligan.
notes: Summary: The dogs speculate about animals going to heaven.

282.title:  Speculation. "Marder for the Cause"
282.author: an editorial by Gary Groth
282.appears_in: p. 11-16 in The Comics Journal, no. 170 (Aug. 1994)
notes: On speculation and Image Comics. 1. Image Comics. I. Groth, Gary. k. Speculation. Call no.: PN6700.C62no.170

283.title:  Speculation. "Those Big Round Blobs Right in the Middle of the Envelope"
283.author: Al Capp & Bob Lubbers.
notes: Summary: Sam speculates on the reason for tears on the "letter that came out of the sky."

284.title:  "Speculation in Slugs"
284.author: by Joseph Millard
284.appears_in: 2 p. text in Captain Marvel Jr., no. 46 (Feb. 1947).

285.title:  Speculative Discontent. Cosmic Underground : a Grimoire of Black Speculative Discontent
285.author: edited by Reynaldo Anderson and John Jennings ; introduction by Greg Tate.
notes: Published in conjunction with the exhibition "Unveiling Visions" showcased at the Schomburg Library in New York City in 2015.

Summary (from amazon.com via OCLC): "Cosmic Underground serves as a creative, experimental and educational motive force to analyze the growing corpus of work surrounding the nexus between politics and contemporary artistic production. This project includes the areas of black cultural production situated within Afrofuturism, AstroBlackness, the EthnoGothic, Magical Realism, Sword and Soul, and the AfroSurreal."
A book of and about African American speculative art and fiction.

286.title:  A Speculative Graphic Memoir. From the Ashes : a Speculative Graphic Memoir
286.author: by Bob Fingerman ; edited by Scott Dunbier.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): A futuristic memoir where Bob Fingerman imagines if he and his wife Michelle survived nuclear armageddon in New York City and chronicled their experiences.
